table-wrap.anchoringText: Injection rates varied between 150 â€“ 450 bbl/d/injection well and injected viscosity varied between 45 cp (at the beginning of the injection) to about 125 cp after February 2013 (Figure 5). In total 0.75 PV of polymer solution were injected in pattern 1M101, 0.64 PV in pattern 1N062 and 0.56 PV in pattern 1M052 (Table 1). In order to achieve sufficient injectivity the wells were operated above fracturing pressure; this point will be discussed further below.
table-wrap.label: Table 1
table-wrap.caption: Summary of injected volumes/viscosity by pattern as of March 2015

formatted-caption.caption-text: Summary of injected volumes/viscosity by pattern as of March 2015

table-wrap.anchoringText: Decline curve analysis was performed for all the wells in the area to determine the incremental recovery on a well-by-well basis. The results of this analysis allowed us to determine the incremental oil produced in each pattern (Table 2). Incremental oil production was estimated to be 11.3% STOOIP for the wells in the patterns (9 production wells).
table-wrap.label: Table 2
table-wrap.caption: Summary of incremental oil recovery by pattern

formatted-caption.caption-text: Summary of incremental oil recovery by pattern
